subject: Re: [junit] Testing server components with a Mock context
msgSnippet: Hi Stefano, ... Personally, I like the fact that using MockEJB s MockContextFactory class for testing does not imply anything about the implementation of the
messageBody:
Hi Stefano,

On 10/14/07, stefano_nichele <stefano.nichele@...> wrote:
> I'm doing test cases for some server components that run in tomcat and
> that perform datasource lookup. [...] What do you think about
> simple-jndi vs MockEJB ? (note that I'm not interesting in ejb)

Personally, I like the fact that using MockEJB's MockContextFactory
class for testing does not imply anything about the implementation of
the production code. I'm not sure if this is the case with
simple-jndi?

Lasse

--
Lasse Koskela
* Author of "Test Driven" (Manning Publications, 2007) *
* Reaktor Innovations * http://www.ri.fi/en *
